Back to Sergei Prokofiev

Sergei Prokofiev

Waltzes (Franz Schubert)

1920

[IMSLP]

This is a single piece comprising arrangements of various dances by Franz Schubert. Prokofiev also wrote a version for two pianos. The original dances are given below; the numbering of the incipits here is purely for ease of identification and does not originate from Prokofiev.

incipitsource
ITwelve Valses nobles, D 969, no. 5
IITwelve Valses nobles, D 969, no. 7 [second half]
IIITwenty Waltzes, D 146, no. 3 [trio]
IVThirty-four Valses sentimentales, D 779, no. 8
VTwelve deutsche Tänze, D 790, no. 6
VITwelve deutsche Tänze, D 790, no. 3
VIITwelve deutsche Tänze, D 790, no. 5
VIIISixteen deutsche Tänze and two Ecossaises, D 783, deutscher Tanz no. 1
= Twelve deutsche Tänze, D 790, no. 2
IXTwelve Waltzes, seventeen Ländler and nine Ecossaises, D 145, waltz no. 9
XThirty-six Originaltänze, D 365, no. 31
XIThirty-four Valses sentimentales, D 779, no. 10
XIIThirty-four Valses sentimentales, D 779, no. 3
XIIISixteen Ländler and two Ecossaises, D 734, Ländler no. 14
XIVThirty-four Valses sentimentales, D 779, no. 12
XVTwelve Waltzes, seventeen Ländler and nine Ecossaises, D 145, waltz no. 10

Duration: 9' 30"

Difficulty: 3
